Description: Painted pottery shabti of Djedkhons, a Wʿb-priest of Amun with a worn head with the remains of a lappet-wig and crossed hands in relief(damaged) holding two black hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket; the lower leg section has broken away.
Condition: incomplete - leg section missing, head worn
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
